What happens to the HUGE amount of money we paid as our co-pay for part D coverage for 90 patches??  We paid out of pocket $264.25 and Part D plan paid for us $429.75 and this put husband into the dough hole so that now we are into the part of paying 100% for medicines.  We need assistance to return these patches we have and reimbursement so that on fixed income we have a little to use for more medicines which are very expensive and hard to pay for on very, very fixed income.

column2: triad, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have acute restless leg syndrome. Since I have had Gastric Bypass most meds don"t disolve properly in my stomach.  This patch has been wonderful.  After a year of suffering I am now feeling normal.

column2: mwilmesmer, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Mobilty and stiffness is much better.  Tremors are a little worse.  I am having a lot of difficulty sleeping at night.  Overall the treatment is better than adverse reactions.

column2: Spike, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Using the patch is great because it has eliminated having to take so many pills. The effectiveness of the patch appears to weaken at times. Sometimes I have to assist it during those times with additional meds.I am a regular exerciser and have found that sweat is definitely a problem. Need to design a more effective releasing substance and adhesive combo. Overall, I like it.
